availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, attorney. Married to Maria A. Hill. Father of Zuritha L. Hill, Mary Hill, Anna M. Hill, Alfred A. Hill, Thomas P. Hill, and W. Bailey Hill. Married to Fannie A. Peyton Hill. Father of Fannie F. Hill. Attorney in Pulaski County in 1850. Attorney in Lincoln County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division No. 1, p. 289B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, p. 16

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Stanford, p. 96B
Find A Grave, "Thomas Pinckney Hill (1826-1908)," Memorial #41316140, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41316140 (accessed July 2, 2019).
